alert.note: Alert for Harnett; Lee; Moore; Richmond (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 15 at 2:39AM EDT by NWS Raleigh
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 545 AM EDT EARLY THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of central North Carolina, including the following counties, Harnett, Lee, Moore and Richmond. * WHEN...Until 545 AM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Ponding of water in urban or other areas is occurring or is imminent. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 238 AM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Up to 3 inches of rain have fallen between Ellerbe and Whispering Pines. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Sanford, Southern Pines, Rockingham, Lillington, Carthage, Pinehurst, Dunn, Aberdeen, Angier, Benson, Hoffman, Erwin, Whispering Pines, Coats, Pinebluff, Broadway, Ellerbe, Foxfire, Taylortown and Vass.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
